required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of MYCOBIOTIC® in Children With Stool Culture Positive for Candida sp.
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of MYCOBIOTIC® In Children With Stool Culture Positive for Candida sp. Double Blind, Placebo Controlled, Prospective, Cross-over Multicenter Study.

collaborator.agency: Medical Network M. Woynarowski, J. Kierkuś Spółka jawna (MED-NET)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, randomised, double blind, placebo controlled, parallel arm, cross-over, multicentre study conducted in a population of children with stool culture positive for Candida sp. observed at outpatient primary health care centres.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: randomised, double blind, placebo controlled, parallel arm, cross-over
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Reducuction of the rate of patients with stool culture positive for Candida sp.
primary_outcome.description: assess whether administration of MYCOBIOTIC® reduces the rate of patients with stool culture positive for Candida sp. in children.

secondary_outcome.measure: MYCOBIOTIC® influence for the intensity of abdominal pain;
secondary_outcome.description: ssess if administration of MYCOBIOTIC® influence the intensity of the abdominal symptoms reported by parents or caregivers - abdominal pain;

secondary_outcome.measure: MYCOBIOTIC® influence for the intensity of stool frequency and consistency
secondary_outcome.description: assess if administration of MYCOBIOTIC® influence the intensity of the abdominal symptoms reported by parents or caregivers - stool frequency and consistency

secondary_outcome.measure: MYCOBIOTIC® influence for the intensity of abdominal distention
secondary_outcome.description: assess if administration of MYCOBIOTIC® influence the intensity of the abdominal symptoms reported by parents or caregivers - abdominal distention

secondary_outcome.measure: MYCOBIOTIC® influence for the intensity of abdominal bloating
secondary_outcome.description: assess if administration of MYCOBIOTIC® influence the intensity of the abdominal symptoms reported by parents or caregivers - abdominal bloating

secondary_outcome.measure: MYCOBIOTIC® influence for the intensity of vomiting
secondary_outcome.description: assess if administration of MYCOBIOTIC® influence the intensity of the abdominal symptoms reported by parents or caregivers - vomiting

clinical_study.condition: Stool Culture Positive for Candida Species

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Boys and girls aged 3-15 years
2. Presence of symptoms suggesting possibility of Candida sp. presence in the stool
3. Informed consent for participation in the study signed by parents/ legal caregivers and child 13+ years old.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Chronic intestinal disease, immunodeficiency or immunosuppressive treatment.
2. Chronic or acute diarrheal disease.
3. Use of laxatives or antydiarrhoeal treatment within the week before inclusion in the study.
4. Antibiotic treatment for the last four weeks before inclusion in the study.
5. Intake of probiotic products for the last two weeks before inclusion in the study
6. Known hypersensitivity to any of the ingredients in the probiotic product or the placebo (corn starch, magnesium stearate ± bacterial culture).

facility.name: Świętokrzyskie Centrum Pediatrii - Poradnia Gastroenterologiczna dla Dzieci
